definition: YMCA (international Christian youth movement, formed in 1844)
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
green/blue/black/youth/young (of people)
grain/harvest (old)/variant of 年[nian2]
surname Nian
year/CL:個|个[ge4]
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Maybe, though I doubt many actual ska rockers went to see “A Chorus Line.”
sentences.chinese: 我严重怀疑摇滚青年会去百老汇看表演吗？

sentences.english: I began to get interested in YMCA work.
sentences.chinese: 我开始对基督教青年会的工作产生兴趣了。

sentences.english: Many gyms, community centers, and YMCAs offer yoga classes.
sentences.chinese: 很多体育馆，社区，基督教青年会都开设瑜伽课程。

sentences.english: See if your area has a YMCA.
sentences.chinese: 观察你附近的区域是否有基督教青年会。

sentences.english: I think about China during Wes's swimming lessons at the YMCA.
sentences.chinese: 维斯在基督教青年会学游泳的时候我想到了中国。

sentences.english: You can find classes at your local YMCA, too.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以在当地的基督教青年会找到这样的课程。

sentences.english: I work at the YMCA with kids.
sentences.chinese: 我在基督教青年会教小朋友。

sentences.english: Jack used to see Marvin playing handball at the Y.
sentences.chinese: 杰克过去总是在基督教青年会观看马文打手球。

sentences.english: This song is specially written for Dharma Drum Youth.
sentences.chinese: 特别为法鼓山青年会所创作。

sentences.english: Excuse me, sir. Could you tell me how to get to the YWCA building?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，先生，你可以告诉我怎样去女青年会吗？

definition: a reading group/press (i.e. publishing house)

Yan Fu (1853-1921), influential Chinese writer and translator of Western books, esp. on social sciences
to attend (a school)/to drop out (of college etc)
Dagger Society, anti-Qing secret society who mounted an unsuccessful rebellion in 1855
the original name of 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1], Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3]
